original: Fridlund, Nils Oskar Teofil, läroverksadjunkt, Växjö, f. 13/10/83 i Ma(l-mö av överlär. Jöns F. o. Elsa Ohlsson. G. 25 m. Astrid Gustafsson. Barn: Ingrid f. 26, Margareta 29. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 03, fil. kand. i Lund 06. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Engl. 08, Tyskl. o. Österr. 10, Tyskl, Engl. o. Holl. f. biblistud. 21, Danm. dito 31. Vik. adj. v. Malmö gymn. 07, i Linköp. s. å., vik. ilektor i Västerås 09’-13, adj. i Härnösand 13, adj. i modersm., tyska o. eng. v. Växjö h. a. 1. sed. 17. Bibi. v. Växjö stifts- o. gymnrbibl. sed. 19, stadsbibi. sed. 21. Deputerad i Lärov:-lär. riksförb. 21-29, skolöverstyr. omb. v. realex. 23-27, ordf. i Kronob. L ibibl .-’förb. sed. 21, led. av folksk :styr. 22-31, av skolöverstyr. förordn. insp. ’ f. Växjö föreläsn :fören. 33. Skr,: Växjö stifts- o. gymn:bibl. hist. (22). RVO 38.
translated: Fridlund, Nils Oskar Teofil, high school teacher, Växjö, born on October 13, 1883 in Malmö, son of headmaster Jöns F. and Elsa Ohlsson. Married on May 25th to Astrid Gustafsson. Children: Ingrid (born in 1926) and Margareta (born in 1929). Completed high school in Malmö in 1903, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1906. Traveled to Germany and England in 1908, Germany and Austria in 1910, Germany, England and Holland for biblical studies in 1921 and Denmark in 1931. Acting teacher at Malmö Gymnasium in 1907, in Linköping the same year, substitute lecturer in Västerås 1909-1913, teacher in Härnösand in 1913 and teacher in mother tongue, German and English at Växjö högre allmänna läroverk since 1917. Librarian at Växjö diocese and Gymnasium Library since 1919, city librarian since 1921. Deputy for the National Association of High School Teachers from 1921-1929, school superintendent representative for realskolan from 1923-1927, chairman of Kronoberg County Library Association since 1921, member of the primary school board from 1922-1931, appointed inspector for Växjö lecture association in 1933. Written work: History of Växjö Diocese and Gymnasium Library (1922). Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) in 1938.

structured.name: Nils Oskar Teofil Fridlund

education.name: Biblical studies in Germany, England, and Holland

worksFor.name: Växjö högre allmänna läroverk
worksFor.jobTitle: Teacher in Mother Tongue, German, and English

structured.description: Nils Oskar Teofil Fridlund (1883-10-13) was a Swedish high school teacher. He was born in Malmö, son of headmaster Jöns F. and Elsa Ohlsson. He completed his high studies in Malmö and obtained his Bachelor of Arts in Lund. He studied in Germany, England, Austria, Holland, and Denmark for biblical studies. He worked as a substitute lecturer and teacher in various cities and schools before becoming a teacher in mother tongue, German, and English at Växjö högre allmänna läroverk in 1917. He worked as a librarian at Växjö diocese and Gymnasium Library and as a city librarian. He was a member of various organizations and was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) in 1938.
